image.altText: A woman smiles.

props.synopsis: A trial has been scheduled to determine whether a man was mentally incompetent when he allegedly stabbed a woman to death at a real estate business in Adelaide's south-west.

title.children: Murder accused pleads not guilty to alleged stabbing of women

image.altText: Peter Doyle is seated at a table in room with dark walls. A window looks to clothing hung up in a row on the wall

props.synopsis: Peter Doyle was outraged at the price rise his electricity provider was offering â€” and began asking questions. Now, that provider, ENGIE, has agreed to issue backdated price reductions to up to 3,000 South Australian customers.

title.children: Energy giant defends rate, then admits it's 'erroneous and in need of correction'

image.altText: A close up of a whale tail flicking water

props.synopsis: Whale poo found on a remote South Australian beach has the potential to help protect endangered southern right whales from climate change, by revealing clues about their diet and gut health.

title.children: Whale poo washed up on remote beach could help protect species

image.altText: A small part of an old, rusting jetty

props.synopsis: A dive tour operator already grappling with the impact of the state's algal bloom says his business will not survive if the government does not repair the old Rapid Bay jetty and reopen the "world-class" dive site surrounding it.

title.children: Operator says business will go under if SA dive site doesn't reopen

image.altText: A man with brown curly hair, wearing a red t-shirt and overshirt, singing at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Performing in front of more than 15,000 people, Leo Sayer played some of his most famous songs at the fifth annual Mundi Mundi Bash music festival in outback NSW.

title.children: At 77 years young, Leo Sayer says his best years are still ahead of him

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and glasses in a pink hoodie standing in front of a wall of sewing and crafting supplies.

props.synopsis: Domenica Tootell's sewing videos have racked up millions of views and thousands of followers. She is among a growing number of creators becoming entrepreneurs on social media.

title.children: Teacher turns sewing hobby into social media business

image.altText: A older man in a suit holds up a graduation certificate inside a court room

props.synopsis: When Tim Looker retired, he was keen to pick up a hobby. So he returned to university, becoming a lawyer on his 74th birthday.

title.children: Tim returned to uni in his 70s and is now a lawyer

image.altText: close up of a truffle.

props.synopsis: Growers say the price of truffles is justified due to their rarity, especially as drought conditions this year have made them even harder to find.Â

title.children: Demand for truffles continues to climb despite $3,500 per kilo price tag

image.altText: A dusty valley with small roads and paths cut into the side of a hillside, which sits beside a small collection of buildings.

props.synopsis: The E1 settlement, approved last week by the Israeli government after years of delays due to international pressure, would effectively bisect the West Bank â€” something its backers and opponents both acknowledge would devastate the prospects of a future Palestinian state.

title.children: Israeli settlers encroached on the West Bank for decades. This is different

image.altText: John Howard

props.synopsis: New analysis argues that under John Howard, the Liberal Party became increasingly influenced by a social conservatism that emphasised traditional gender norms.

title.children: Howard paved the way for Abbott, Morrison and the Liberal Party's 'women problem'

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce hasÂ denied his push to repeal net zero is undermining Opposition Leader Sussan Ley's leadership.Â Follow live.Â

title.children: Joyce denies undermining 'great lady' Sussan Ley on net zero

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sussan Ley a 'great lady', Joyce says as he denies he's undermining her on net zero
Ali France says Nationals are 'undermining' Sussan Ley

image.altText: Claire O Neil

props.synopsis: The failure to match population with housing and infrastructure has led to a more serious decline in living standards than is evident from GDP per capita statistics.

title.children: Treasury is preoccupied with three P-words that won't improve your life

image.altText: Umpire James Keothavong speaks to an Australian fan in the stands at the US Open.

props.synopsis: A fan is sent out of Australian Jordan Thompson's first-round victory at the US Open, much to the delight of other members of the crowd.Â

title.children: Australian booted out of US Open match after Frenchman complains

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda runs in celebration after a goal

props.synopsis: Nestory Irankunda pleads with his teammate to take a free kick before putting the ball into the corner of the net as Watford secures a 1-1 draw with Swansea City.Â

title.children: 'Look at my highlight reels': Irankunda opens English account with wondergoal

image.altText: Ken Hinkley at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Any coach embarking on a 13-year reign at an AFL club would probably accept 12 wooden spoons if they came with a single silver cup â€” but while that prize eluded Ken Hinkley's Port Adelaide, he is departing the Power with the blessing of the "footy gods".

title.children: Hinkley's time is up, but he's the 'proudest coach the world has seen'

image.altText: image of middle aged man holding a large photo of an older man with a stern expression in a garden

props.synopsis: Stephen Douglas died in a seven-minute attack by a patient during a home visit. The situation bore "significant similarities" to another workplace stabbing 12 months earlier.

title.children: Family of mental health nurse killed by a client demands reform

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce points to himself as he addresses the chamber

props.synopsis: Labor will seek to maximise internal Coalition divisions over whether to scrap its net zero emissions commitment, allowing debate in the chamber today on Barnaby Joyce's bill to repeal climate laws.

title.children: Labor puts hurt on Coalition divide, allowing debate on Joyce's net zero bill

image.altText: A child scooters in front of a row of houses.

props.synopsis: A scheme to allow all first homebuyers to purchase a property with only a 5 per cent deposit will begin in October, three months earlier than Labor promised at the federal election.

title.children: Five per cent home deposit scheme to begin in October

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Comments from Fed chair Jerome Powell send Wall Street higher as the odds of a US rate cut shorten. The ASX jumps in response and heads for a record close. Follow live.

title.children: ASX rallies after Jerome Powell signals possible rate cut

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX stays afloat in the tempest: JP Morgan
ASX loses momentum as investors bail on banks
Aussie Broadband surges on profit jump and new wholesale agreement

image.altText: A man sits with his chin resting on his hands watching intently.

props.synopsis: Sharks assistant coach Josh Hannay has signed a three-season contract to coach the Titans as they remain at the bottom of the NRL ladder after four straight losses.

title.children: Josh Hannay to replace Des Hasler as Gold Coast Titans coach

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: A posthumous memoir by Virginia Giuffre, who alleged she was trafficked for sex to Prince Andrew by Jeffrey Epstein, will be published later this year.Â

title.children: Epstein accuser Giuffre wrote a memoir. Months after her death, it's coming out

image.altText: A large column of smoke seen over the skyline of Sanaa

props.synopsis: Houthi media outlets say two people are dead. Israel says the strikes were retaliation for a missile launch by the Houthis on Friday.Â

title.children: Israeli retaliatory strikes hit Yemeni presidential palace

image.altText: Nigerian military

props.synopsis: The rescued hostages include some of those kidnapped during an attack on a mosque that left more than 50 people dead last week.

title.children: Nigerian military rescues 76 hostages

image.altText: A large white and red ferry comes in to dock while people in the foreground watch from a wharf.

props.synopsis: The ship will stay in Hobart for about two months, then it will be moved to Victoria until it's ready to be used on the Bass Strait crossing in a year's time.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV set for storage in Victoria after Hobart fit-out

image.altText: A man sits in a boardroom wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Adler starred as Tony Soprano's adviser Hesh Rabkin across all six seasons of The Sopranos and played law partner Howard Lyman in The Good Wife.

title.children: Jerry Adler, star of The Sopranos and The Good Wife, dies aged 96

image.altText: A mine in the Great Southern.

props.synopsis: Ausgold's deal includes an 860-hectare land acquisition, as well as compensation and relocation of the farming families involved.

title.children: Gold miner's 860ha farmland buy-up 'last piece of the puzzle'

image.altText: A Ukrainian flag in a London street.

props.synopsis: Demonstrations are held in Ukraine and across Europe as the country marks its 34th year of independence and the fourth year since Russia's invasion began.Â

title.children: Vance says Russia granting concessions as Ukraine marks independence

image.altText: An old white church with green eaves. The paint is deterioriating.

props.synopsis: A church diocese covering a third of Queensland has entered receivership.

title.children: Church diocese goes into receivership following abuse claims

image.altText: Boundary Umpire Greta Miller throws the ball in.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend, Melissa Sambrooks, Kaitlin Barr and Greta Miller became the first ever female AFL boundary umpires.

title.children: 'Couldn't stop smiling': First female boundary umpires in AFL

image.altText: Trish and Ian, two older people, stand and smile in a garden outside a house.

props.synopsis: Stellulata is a co-housing project designed and built by three Canberra couples who wanted to enjoy both privacy and community.

title.children: Three Canberra couples create communal home by changing planning laws

image.altText: A hospital bed is pushed down a corridor towards the camera.

props.synopsis: The peak private hospitals body has written to the prime minister, detailing what it claims are some of the worst behaviours by private health insurers.Â

title.children: 'Toxic' relationship between private insurers and hospitals deteriorates

image.altText: A woman's hands holding approx 20 glow sticks

props.synopsis: Advocates say the glow sticks â€” used in longline fishing â€” can cause plastic and chemical pollution to oceans.

title.children: Thousands of fishing glow sticks wash up on Australian beaches

image.altText: Graham "Buzz" Bidstrup sitting behind a drum kit, looking off to one side smiling. T-shirt says 'The show must go on'

props.synopsis: Graham "Buzz" Bidstrup intervened to ensure the classic line "This is Australia" remained in the song Sounds of Then (This is Australia). He tells this and many other stories about the Australian music industry in his new memoir No Secrets.

title.children: A famous Australian song almost didn't sound the way it does today
